member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Practitioner
member.summary: FHIR Practitioner resource. A practitioner is someone who practices medicine for treating patients. They can be general medicine practitioners or specialists in some healthcare discipline.

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Immunization
member.summary: Immunization resource is intended to cover the recording of current and historical administration of vaccines to patients.

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Observation
member.summary: As per HL7 org, Observations are central elements in healthcare. They are used to support diagnosis, monitor progress, determine baselines and patterns and even capture demographic characteristics. Most observations are simple name/value pair assertions with some metadata, but some observations group other observations together logically, or even are multi-component observations.

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.DiagnosticReport
member.summary: As per HL7 org, a diagnostic report is the set of information that is typically provided by a diagnostic service when investigations are complete. The information includes a mix of atomic results, text reports, images, and codes.

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.DiagnosticReport.subject
member.summary: The subject of this diagnosis report - usually, but not always, the patient.

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.DiagnosticReport.encounter
member.summary: Health care event when test ordered

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.DiagnosticReport.issued
member.summary: Time the report is issued. An instant in time in the format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss+zz:zz (e.g. 2015-02-07T13:28:17.239+02:00 or 2017-01-01T00:00:00Z). A system log kind of format is needed to accurately know when the report was generated or issued. The time shall specify at least to the second and shall include a time zone.

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.DiagnosticReport.performer
member.summary: Responsible Diagnostic Service who performed these diagnoses. Could be a list of references.

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.DiagnosticReport.result
member.summary: Observations

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode
member.summary: Codes for the clinical conclusion of test results

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Procedure
member.summary: As per HL7 org, Procedure resource is used to record the details of current and historical procedures performed on or for a patient. A procedure is an activity that is performed on, with, or for a patient as part of the provision of care. Examples include surgical procedures, diagnostic procedures, endoscopic procedures, biopsies, counseling, physiotherapy, personal support services, adult day care services, non-emergency transportation, home modification, exercise, etc. Procedures may be performed by a healthcare professional, a service provider, a friend or relative or in some cases by the patient themselves.

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntolerance
member.summary: AllergyIntolerance denotes a risk of harmful or undesirable, physiological response which is unique to an individual and is associated with an exposure to a substance.

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntolerance.clinicalStatus
member.summary: Whether it is resolved, active/inactive

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntolerance.verificationStatus
member.summary: Whether the allergy or intolerance is verified/confirmed.

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntolerance.category
member.summary: Category of allergy/intolerance. e.g. food | medication | environment | biologic

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntolerance.recorder
member.summary: Who recorded this sensitivity or reaction?

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntolerance.asserter
member.summary: /// Source of the information of the allergy

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntolerance.lastOccurrence
member.summary: Date(/time) of last known occurrence of a reaction

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntolerance.note
member.summary: Additional text not captured in other fields

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntolerance.reaction
member.summary: Reactions to the substance or allergies noted

member.summary: AllergyIntolerance.clinicalStatus

member.summary: AllergyIntolerance.code | AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntoleranceQueryParameters.criticality
member.summary: AllergyIntolerance.criticality

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntoleranceQueryParameters.date
member.summary: AllergyIntolerance.recordedDate in yyyy-MM-dd format.

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntoleranceQueryParameters.identifier
member.summary: AllergyIntolerance.identifier

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.AllergyIntoleranceQueryParameters.onset
member.summary: AllergyIntolerance.reaction.onset in yyyy-MM-dd format.

member.summary: AllergyIntolerance.patient

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Reaction
member.summary: Records reaction or allergy to a substance.

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.Reaction.substance
member.summary: Specific substance or pharmaceutical product considered to be responsible for event

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.Reaction.manifestation
member.summary: Clinical symptoms/signs associated with the Event

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.Reaction.description
member.summary: Description of the event as a whole

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.Reaction.onset
member.summary: Date(/time) when manifestations showed

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.Reaction.severity
member.summary: mild | moderate | severe (serverity of the event as a whole)

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.Reaction.exposureRoute
member.summary: How the subject was exposed to the substance

member.name: P:Common.FHIR.Reaction.note
member.summary: Notes

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Annotation
member.summary: Annotation on the specific record.

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Encounter
member.summary: As per HL7 org, Encounter resource is not to be used to store appointment information. Rather the Appointment resource is intended to be used for that. Appointment is used for establishing a date for the encounter, while Encounter resource is applicable to information about the actual Encounter, i.e., the patient showing up.

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Quantity
member.summary: Indicates values with quantity, unit for vital signs etc.

member.summary: FHIR Organization class.

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Contact
member.summary: Contact details of a resource such as Organization or Patient.

member.name: T:Common.FHIR.Patient
member.summary: FHIR Patient class.
